item.title: Multiplication of Polynomials
item.description: Multiplication of binomials follow this rule: $$s(a+b)(c+d)=ac+ad+bc+bd$$e This can be easily remembered by using the FOIL method: Multiply the first terms: $sac$e Multiply the outer terms: $sad$e Multiply the inner terms: $sbc$e Multiply the last terms: $sbd$e Example $$s(3x-1)(4-2x)$$e $$s12x-6x^2-4+2x$$e $$s-6x^2+14x-4$$e Since the FOIL method is derived from the distribution rule, for trinomials (e.g. $s(a+b+c)(d+e+f)$e ), we can use the FFMOMFMMOIIMIO method: (this is a joke, please just distribute it on-the-fly)

item.title: Binomial Expansion
item.description: The binomial theorem describes how to expand powers of binomials. Example Using the theorem, $s(x+2)^3$e is $s8 + 12 x + 6 x^2 + x^3$e . The $sr$e th coefficient for the $sn$e th is $sn\choose r$e , pronounced “n choose r”. Example The 4th coefficient of $s(3x+8)^6$e is $s6\choose 3$e $s(3x)^38^3$e $s=276480x^3$e

item.title: Factor Perfect Square Trinomials and Difference of Squares
item.description: Difference of Squares $$sa^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)$$e Example $$s4x^2-16$$e $$s=(2x-4)^2$$e Perfect Square Trinomials $$sa^2+2ab+b^2=(a+b)$$e $$sa^2-2ab+b^2=(a-b)$$e Example $$s4x^2+20x+25$$e $$s=(2x+5)^2$$e

item.title: Factor Quadratics 2
item.description: To factor trinomials in the form $sax^2+bx+c$e : $$sy+z=ac$$e $$syz=b$$e $$sax^2+bx+c$$e $$s=ax^2+yx+zx+c$$e Example $$s6x^2+17x+12$$e Because $sy+z=ac$e $syz=b$e , $sy=8$e and $sz=9$e . $$s=6x^2+8x+9x+12$$e $$s=2x(3x+4)+3(3x+4)$$e Then, factor by grouping. $$s=(2x+3)(3x+4)$$e

item.title: Factor Quadratics
item.description: To factor trinomials in the form $sx^2+bx+c$e : $$sy+z=c$$e $$syz=b$$e $$sx^2+bx+c$$e $$s=(x+y)(x+z)$$e Example $$sx^4+11x^2+30$$e $$s=(x^2+6)(x^2+5)$$e

item.title: Common Factoring
item.description: Factoring is the opposite of exapanding (what we did so far). To factor a polynomial, group the polynomials by the GCF: $$s8x^2y^2-12x^4y$$e $$s4x^2y(2y^2-3x^2)$$e Example Remember: a GCF does not have to be a monomial. In this case, it is $sx+2$e . $$sa(x+2)+b(x+2)$$e $$s=(a+b)(x+2)$$e You can also factor by grouping terms with a common factor: Example $$s2am+8a+4m+16$$e $$s=(4+m)(2a+4)$$e $$s=2(a+2)(m+4)$$e

item.title: Special Products
item.description: When squaring a binomial, the result becomes: $$s(a+b)^2$$e $$s=a^2+2ab+b^2$$e $$s(a-b)^2$$e $$s=a^2-2ab+b^2$$e Example $$s(3x-2y)^2$$e $$s=9x^2-12xy+4y^2$$e
